subject: Technology
title: Space Junk: The Orbiting Trash Problem
description: Learn Space Junk: The Orbiting Trash Problem in one minute.

hook.text: Over 100 million pieces of debris orbit Earth. Most are tiny, but even a paint fleck can damage a spacecraft.

buildup.text: Every rocket launch leaves something behind: spent stages, bolts, even astronaut gloves.

discovery.text: At orbital speeds, a marble-sized piece of junk hits with the force of a hand grenade.

twist.text: If one collision creates enough fragments, it could trigger a chain reaction destroying most satellites.

climax.text: This scenario, called Kessler Syndrome, could make certain orbits unusable for generations.

punchline.text: We might one day be trapped on Earth by our own garbage.

quiz.question: What is Kessler Syndrome?
options: A disease caused by space travel
A chain reaction of collisions making orbits unusable
A type of rocket fuel explosion
